meanings.definition: Becoming worse in quality or condition.
meanings.sent1: The deteriorating building had peeling paint and cracked walls.
meanings.sent2: The old book's deteriorating pages were yellowed and torn.
meanings.sent3: The deteriorating cake looked like it had been left out in the sun too long.
meanings.sent4: Her deteriorating patience was like a balloon slowly losing air.
meanings.sent5: The deteriorating bridge creaked ominously with each passing car.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the fruit out in the sun will deteriorate its freshness.
meanings.sent2: The lack of maintenance caused the house to start deteriorating.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his cooking skills were so bad, they could deteriorate a steel stomach.
meanings.sent4: The constant stress was deteriorating her mental health like a storm eroding a cliff.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments were deteriorating his confidence like acid eating away at metal.
